column1: There was a table set out under a tree in front of the house
column2: and the March Hare and the Hatter were having tea at it: a Dormouse was sitting between them
column4: and the other two were using it as a cushion
column6: and talking over its head. "Very uncomfortable for the Dormouse
column9: I suppose it doesn't mind."The table was a large one
column10: but the three were all crowded together at one corner of it: "No room! No room!" they cried out when they saw Alice coming. "There's plenty of room!" said Alice
column12: and she sat down in a large arm-chair at one end of the table."Your hair wants cutting
column13: said the Hatter. He had been looking at Alice for some time with great curiosity, and this was his first speech.You should learn not to make personal remarks
column14: Alice said with some severity: it's very rude."The Hatter opened his eyes very wide on hearing this; but all he said was: "Why is a raven like a writing-desk?"
